Text: Calling all #GardenCity residents! Please join us for a telephone town hall Wednesday, February 23rd at 5:30PM where we'll share new resources, provide legislative updates, and ensure you can access our office for assistance. To join, just dial in at 855-962-1056. https://t.co/do6ueVHiOi
This is yet another reprehensible action taken again Steven Donziger. He should be home and free. https://t.co/AqVpWvtQbm
We cannot build back better if parents are burdened with high costs and a lack of options. We must invest in child care and Pre-K. https://t.co/wDjKKwd0cs

Child care costs more today than many families pay for rent, a mortgage, or even college tuition. In MI, child care costs the average family $10,870 per year. Families need affordable, quality child care. https://t.co/NTp0DH2ztm

Many families are still struggling to pay their mortgage, property taxes, association fees or utility bills because of the COVID-19 pandemic, The MIHAF is here to help. You may be eligible for up to $25,000 in assistance. Apply today. https://t.co/n3vQEkmvwv

This Valentine’s Day, we have a love note for our country 💞 It’s called the #BuildBackBetterAct which lowers drug prices, childcare costs, provides immigration protections, safe affordable housing, and helps generate green energy to combat the climate crisis and more. https://t.co/xOHrLM5IWR
https://t.co/yO9SJDvWdK

To be clear, the actions @nflcommish Goodell took to protect sexual predators like @Commanders owner Dan Snyder are disgusting. Neither of them should ever be allowed to manage another human being ever again. Goodell must resign and Snyder must be stripped of his team ownership.

Several brave survivors spoke to @OversightDems about the horrific workplace violence at the @Commanders. By protecting sexual predators like owner Dan Snyder and covering up abuse, @NFL led by @nflcommish #rogergoodell is promoting sexual violence. #GoodellMustGo #SnyderMustGo
https://t.co/V4uSQ96ctg

Time and again the US fails to hold @DHS @CBP and @ICE accountable for their racist policies, human rights violations and possible crimes against humanity. @UNHumanRights must launch a transparent investigation into the human rights crisis that is America’s immigration system.

When @DHS deported folks back to #Cameroon, they knew damn well that they were putting their lives at risk, but they didn’t care. Why? The same reason @CBP is getting away with beating Haitian migrants at the border. Because they are Black.

@USPS is an essential part of our economy. They deliver life-saving medications, urgent packages, and much more to Americans across the country. Passing the #PostalServiceReformAct is crucial to ensuring that the Postal Service can continue serving residents. https://t.co/Jgii0haTMD

With the federal funding from ARPA , the Detroit Water and Sewerage Department (DWSD) will be providing a $15 million dollar program to reduce basement backups in 11 flood prone neighborhoods in Detroit. All eligible homeowners can apply online at https://t.co/r1uSwy0kS9

No one should be stripped of their right to feel safe from sexual assault and violence in the workplace. The #EndForcedArbitration Act is critical to ensure abusers are held accountable. https://t.co/vQXnZqazgI

During #BlackHistoryMonth, I am proud to join @RepNikema’s in honoring the legacy of freedom rider, civil rights hero and friend, Congressman John Lewis, by voting to pass #HR5577 to name the Atlanta main post office the John R. Lewis Post office. https://t.co/3zVQzKbbaB
Happy birthday, Mother Parks! Learn more about the bill here: https://t.co/UxB0rWrTFE

Today on what would've been her 109th birthday, I introduced legislation to rename a USPS in Detroit after Rosa McCauley Parks, the mother of the civil rights movement. Her legacy will truly live on forever and I am so happy that she will be honored in this way. #RosaParks https://t.co/9yWfu0RrzJ

Talented Detroit artist @JonHarrisArtist painted this powerful piece called "Critical Race Theory". It gives chilling imagery on how this contrived fight against history, seeks to erase the fight,  triumphs, and success of our Black neighbors. We cannot erase Black History. https://t.co/RJDrAXfYZ3
The End Child Poverty Act would provide a universal monthly benefit of $393 per child and cut child poverty rates more than 60%. Read more here: https://t.co/iGhUtHtiPE

Currently, nearly 11 million—or 1 in 7—U.S. children live in poverty and #ChildrenAreHungry. As a mother, I understand how crucial it is to provide for our children’s health, safety, and development. That is why I am proud to introduce the End Child Poverty Act with @RepMondaire. https://t.co/RxBQWslIyF
The End Child Poverty Act would provide a universal monthly benefit of $393 per child and cut child poverty rates more than 60%. Read more here: https://t.co/iGhUtHtiPE

The average out-of-pocket cost for one vial of insulin in MI is nearly $100–and out of reach for too many who need it. I was proud to join @GovWhitmer and others in #13thDistrictStrong to highlight this and other critical issues. Let’s get them taken care of. https://t.co/FDuk1MiSbe

This International #HolocaustRemembranceDay comes amid a rise in antisemitic hate that we must all commit to combating every day. As #COVID19 rages on, we must look for ways to return to a normal that's better than gross inequality that costs lives. #MondayMustRead

As reproductive rights continue to be under attack, we must codify the right to safe, legal, & accessible abortions. On this 49th anniversary of Roe v. Wade, it is critical that we take bold action to ensure those who can become pregnant have full autonomy of their bodies. #Roe49

Today is National #MichiganDay. "Michigan" is derived from the Indigenous Ojibwe word ‘mishigami,’ meaning: ‘large water or lake.’ It is an honor to serve you Michigan.  We work to ensure that residents are protected, supported, and can enjoy the beauties of our state. https://t.co/PASNQccYK4

Passing the #BuildBackBetter Act is critical to making our economy work for families across Michigan. 65 million kids count on the monthly #ChildTaxCredit checks. We cannot let the progress Michigan families made thanks to the American Rescue Plan end here.

The evidence is clear: in six months, the expanded #ChildTaxCredit shored up family finances amidst the continuing crisis, reduced child poverty and food insufficiency, and increased families’ ability to meet their basic needs. We cannot let this progress end here. https://t.co/PUY3jxbbZg

It's clear the pandemic is not over nor is the need to protect our frontline workers. @OSHA_DOL must retain their emergency COVID-19 protections for healthcare workers and issue a permanent standard quickly. Solidarity with nurses and healthcare workers! https://t.co/XWufOvrqiI

Protecting the right to vote is how we save our democracy.
 
This can’t wait. It’s time for the Senate to act. #VotingRightsNow

State legislatures are passing laws to diminish the political power of communities of color.

Senators that refuse to act in the face of this crisis are greenlighting racist voter suppression—and saying that the voices of their constituents of color aren't worth being heard. https://t.co/25TauZBAb3

1 in 3 young folks are growing up without a mentor, someone outside of their family who they can turn to for support and guidance. They’ve certainly made a difference in my life, so this #MentoringMonth, learn how you can help close that mentoring gap at https://t.co/6qcxL249WA. https://t.co/EwIZodnRZV
We cannot deny it. We must call out and hold those who embrace it accountable, and we must take bold action.

Today, the Big Lie persists as the right to vote is continuously being attacked to target Black and brown voters. The insurrection was a violent exclamation point on the white supremacy that exist in this country.

The insurrection on January 6, 2021 was a violent attack in the midst of a continued assault on American democracy. On January 6th, people were killed, harmed, and lives were forever changed because of the Big Lie to protect a lawless President.

This isn’t just a Detroit problem. This new study found that unaffordable water rates are a widespread problem across Michigan. We need to ban shutoffs, forgive debt, and switch to income-based rates that give our families a fair chance.

People also can’t live without water, but here in Michigan rates keep getting more unaffordable. Low-income Detroiters spend at least 1/4th of their disposable income on water bills. Water rates have risen twice as fast as wages since the mid-80s. https://t.co/TE5Wx9aHPa

We have to stop giving money to corporations and expecting them to do right by our people. They only care about their profits. Instead we should be sending billions to homeowners right now to weatherize and fix up their homes.

Greedy utilities received billions in bailouts, have terrible reliability records, and keep raising rates to unaffordable levels. Energy prices will only get worse this year. A national moratorium on utility shutoffs early in the pandemic could have reduced deaths by 15%.

As winter arrives it’s unconscionable that millions of US families are living without power or are at risk of having their heat turned off by corporate utilities. Bill payment assistance isn't enough, we need a national moratorium on utility shutoffs. https://t.co/OQ6rAn3zSI
